title: 107_hr2558
content: The Act titled "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" allows for voluntary early retirement incentive plans for governmental and higher education employees. Amendment to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act allows voluntary early retirement plans for educational agency and higher education employees to provide reduced or eliminated benefits based on age at retirement, as long as age-based reductions are limited to supplemental benefits. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act amendment permits voluntary early retirement plans for educational agency and higher education employees to offer supplemental benefits based on age at retirement, as long as age-based reductions are restricted to supplemental benefits and additional to any general retirement or severance benefits offered within the past year. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows eligible employees to elect to retire after attaining the minimum age and meeting non-age based conditions, with a 180-day election period. Employees not eligible for maximum benefits due to age must have had a previous opportunity to receive them. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to determining violations of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 for early retirement plans in educational agencies or institutions after January 1, 1996. SEC. 3. Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. (a) Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Plans Maintained by Local Educational Agencies.--Section 4(l)(1) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to include voluntary early retirement plans maintained by local educational agencies in coordination with defined benefit plans. (b) Retiree Medical Benefits Coordinated With Medicare Benefits.--Section 4(l) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 addresses coordination of retiree medical benefits with Medicare benefits. The text discusses the coordination of retiree medical benefits with Medicare benefits under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. It states that employee benefit plans providing medical benefits for retired participants can be altered, reduced, or eliminated when the participant is eligible for Medicare benefits. Additionally, it clarifies that plans maintained by a state or agency thereof are considered defined benefit plans. The text discusses the application of amendments to voluntary early retirement incentive plans and employee benefit plans providing medical benefits for retired participants under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. It clarifies that these plans may be subject to violation of the Act if altered after January 1, 1996, and emphasizes that no inference should be drawn from the amendments regarding early retirement plans. The amendment made to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 in 1996 applies to voluntary early retirement plans, but no inference should be made regarding whether these plans constitute a defined benefit plan under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act.
